title: NFL on Saturdays this season? Quarterback Quarantine Strategy (Football 8/12)
description:
A month out from kickoff and we're still speculating what the 2020 NFL season will look like. To help with that speculation, aided by some inside reporting, Jonathan Jones joins Will Brinson to break down COVID-19 related effects on the league. Could teams seriously employ a quarantine strategy among their quarterbacks (9:30)? It's an idea that's been tossed around for months as JJ addresses the validity of the approach. At the time of recording, the Big Ten and Pac 12 had not officially canceled (err, postponed) their college football seasons, but we knew it was coming...With that in mind, the guys discuss the potential for Saturday NFL games this year (19:30). Also, Jonathan explains why identifying character concerns are an even bigger emphasis than normal when deciding to sign a player during these pandemic times (33:00). Lastly, Dwayne Haskins is the guy in Washington, right (46:00)?
'Pick Six' is available on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, Stitcher, Google Podcasts, Castbox and wherever else you listen to podcasts.
